Key Match Events: Andrew Benintendi hit a go-ahead single in the 10th inning, leading the Chicago White Sox to a 4-3 win over the Los Angeles Angels.
Korey Lee hit a two-run homer in the second inning for the White Sox.
Lenyn Sosa hit a tiebreaking solo home run in the fourth inning.
The Angels tied the game in the eighth inning with a squeeze play bunt single by Michael Stefanic.
Post-Match Reflections: White Sox interim manager Grady Sizemore commented on the team's focus and professionalism despite fan frustration.
Angels manager Ron Washington reflected on the team's inability to capitalize on scoring opportunities.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The White Sox avoided a record-breaking 121st loss for the second straight game.
The Angels matched a franchise record with their 95th loss.
Others: Angels' 1B Nolan Schanuel exited the game in the first inning due to a bruised right leg.
